skill.name: swarm-advanced
skill.description: Advanced swarm orchestration patterns for research, development, testing, and complex distributed workflows
skill.summary: Advanced swarm orchestration patterns for research, development, testing, and complex distributed wo...
skill.author: Claude Flow Team

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown documentation skill with no executable code, network calls, or file system access. Contains only documentation patterns and MCP tool usage examples for swarm orchestration guidance.

content.value_statement: Complex projects require coordinated multi-agent execution. This skill provides battle-tested patterns for research, development, testing, and analysis swarms using Claude Flow architecture.
actual_capabilities: Configure mesh, hierarchical, star, and ring swarm topologies
Spawn specialized agents with specific capabilities
Orchestrate parallel and sequential task execution
Implement fault tolerance and error recovery patterns
Manage cross-session memory and state persistence
Monitor swarm health and collect performance metrics
limitations: Requires Claude Flow MCP server installation
Limited to 12 agents per swarm by default
Does not include actual agent implementations
CLI fallback requires Node.js and npm

use_cases.title: Parallel research synthesis
use_cases.description: Coordinate multiple researchers to gather, analyze, and synthesize information from diverse sources

use_cases.title: Full-stack development swarm
use_cases.description: Orchestrate backend, frontend, database, and DevOps agents for complete feature delivery

use_cases.title: Distributed testing orchestration
use_cases.description: Run unit, integration, E2E, and security tests in parallel across specialized tester agents

prompt_templates.title: Quick research swarm
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize a mesh swarm with 4 agents to research [topic]. Use adaptive strategy and parallel task execution.

prompt_templates.title: Development swarm
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a hierarchical swarm with 6 agents to build [feature]. Include architect, backend dev, frontend dev, QA, reviewer, and documenter.

prompt_templates.title: Testing campaign
prompt_templates.prompt: Setup a star topology testing swarm with 5 agents. Spawn coordinator, unit tester, integration tester, E2E tester, and security tester.

prompt_templates.title: Analysis swarm
prompt_templates.prompt: Initialize a mesh analysis swarm to examine [codebase/system]. Include code analyzer, security analyzer, performance profiler, and architecture assessor.

output_examples.input: Create a research swarm to analyze AI trends in 2025

best_practices: Choose topology based on workflow type: mesh for collaboration, hierarchical for structured tasks, star for coordinated testing
Assign distinct capabilities to each agent and avoid overlapping responsibilities for maximum efficiency
Set up fault tolerance and error recovery before running complex parallel operations
anti_patterns: Spawning too many agents for simple tasks creates coordination overhead without benefit
Using parallel execution for tasks with dependencies causes race conditions and failures
Ignoring memory namespace organization leads to data conflicts between swarms

faq.question: What tools support swarm orchestration?
faq.answer: Claude Flow MCP server provides all swarm tools. Install with npm install -g claude-flow@alpha.

faq.question: What is the maximum agent count?
faq.answer: Default limit is 12 agents. Configure via swarm_init parameters for higher limits if needed.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Use workflow_create to define reusable patterns. Connect to CI/CD via CLI commands.

faq.question: Is my data safe in swarm memory?
faq.answer: Memory stores data locally with configurable TTL. Use namespaces to isolate swarm data.

faq.question: Why are agents not coordinating?
faq.answer: Check topology settings, verify memory connectivity, enable swarm_monitor for debugging.

faq.question: How does this differ from single-agent workflows?
faq.answer: Swarms enable parallel execution, specialized agents, and fault tolerance for complex projects.
